message: When I enter the kitchen, Koujaku, Noiz, and Clear are all sitting at the dinner table.
Mink is sitting alone on the couch in the living room.
The table is already covered with Granny's cooking, and my stomach is growling.

name: 紅雀
message: "Finally up?"

name: クリア
message: "Master!"

name: ベニ
message: "Yo, Ren. I came to visit."

name: 蓮
message: "Hello."

name: 紅雀
message: "How you feeling?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Okay. Not great."

name: 紅雀
message: "Can't blame you."
Koujaku nods and lets out a little sigh.
Everyone seems exhausted, for some reason.
Well, I guess it's not too surprising. We did do something pretty insane.

name: 蒼葉
message: "How's Mizuki?"

name: 紅雀
message: "He and the other Dry Juice guys are in the hospital. Doesn't seem like they've woken up yet."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Oh."
Back there, when I faced off with Mizuki as he tried to force Granny into that car... something happened.
I dunno if it was a dream or what―but when I came to, Mizuki was lying on the ground.
What the hell happened to us? There's only one thing I remember clearly.
A vision of my past.
I don't know why I'd forgotten it until now, but I remember...
I remember that I used to play Rhyme.
That explains why I knew how to fight against Noiz.
But... why did I forget?
The memories weren't just vague or distant. It's like the fact that I played Rhyme at all was completely missing from my memory.
Is it really possible to forget something so cleanly?

name: タエ
message: "You're awake."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Granny."
Granny snorts at the look on my face, then sets a plate of food on the table.

name: 蒼葉
message: "I'll help."

name: タエ
message: "I'm already done. Hurry up and take a seat."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Okay."
I obediently sit in an empty chair.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Are you sure you're okay?"

name: タエ
message: "You should worry about yourself before you worry about me. You're the one who collapsed."
She's right. We saved her, but in the end, I guess I just made her worry.
I pick up my plate, fiddling with my chopsticks to hide my shame, and take a bite.
It's delicious. As my appetite reawakens, the gloom clears from my mind.
The others can't stop eating either. It doesn't take long before all the plates on the table are empty.
Mink is the only one who never comes to the table.
